pull.title: Add ellswift usage example
pull.body: This should hopefully be useful as orientation for users implementing the shared secret derivation part of BIP324. Conceptually the example is not very different to the ECDH one, so a lot of code/comments are just copied (e.g. context creation, secret key generation, shared secret comparison, console output, cleanup with secret key clearing).

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

events.message: examples: fix case typos in secret clearing paragraphs (s/, Or/, or/)

Add ellswift usage example

This should hopefully be useful as orientation for users implementing
the key exchange part of BIP324. Conceptually the example is not very
different to the ECDH one, so a lot of code/comments are just copied
(e.g. context creation, secret key generation, shared secret comparison,
console output, cleanup with secret key clearing).

events.body: @real-or-random: Thanks for the quick review, force-pushed with all the suggestions taken.

31f84595c4fa8fcc89021790257b85416aae44f6

I have reviewed both build systems changes and they look OK.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -7,6 +7,9 @@ and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0
 
 ## [Unreleased]
 
+#### Added
+ - Added usage example for a ElligatorSwift key exchange.
comments.body:
```suggestion
 - Added usage example for an ElligatorSwift key exchange.
```

```suggestion
     * EllSwift pubkeys in the same order; the pubkey of the calling party
     * is determined by the "party" boolean (sixth parameter). */
```

I think this is a bit cleaner (still need to reformat the paragraph)

```suggestion
     * example through "out of bounds" array access (see Heartbleed), or the OS
```

is this copied from the other example? Then fix it there too.

nit: I understand that this doesnt adhere to the surrounding code, but, strictly speaking, it should be
```suggestion
/ellswift_example
```
Yeah, feel free to adjust this for the binaries, but I guess either variant is fine (we also have the pattern `*.exe`, which may in rare cases a bit too coarse`...)
